medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute severe hypercalcemia after traumatic fractures and immobilization.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began after two rapid succession falls that broke multiple major bones at age 55. Approximately 6 hours later, he became confused. Serum calcium levels rose to 14.9 mg/dL following the trauma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of Hypophosphatasia (HPP) diagnosed in childhood and chronic renal failure (CRF) requiring hemodialysis attributed to hypertension and anti-inflammatory medication. He also had a history of essential hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and hyperuricemia.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's 52-year-old brother had similar clinical manifestations of HPP.
